title: Must work faster
body:
It's looks as though the battle lines are being drawn. In the first corner, wearing tails and frilly lace, we have the Criterion Crew [ applause ], and in the second corner, wearing a denim jacket and a half scowl / half smirk, we have the Moxie Mob [ applause ]. To commemorate this epic battle, I had initially planned on unveiling a nice, little flash movie that highlighted some of the pros and cons of each side's stance. Unfortunately, due to my compulsive perfectionism, I was unable to finish it, which leaves me with a lot of nothing to say.

This post was only supposed to be a couple sentences long... you know, something like:

"Hey everyone, I just spent the last 3 hours building this AMAZING flash movie that depicts the epic battle currently waging betwixt our potential theater names. I'd really be tickled if you'd take a look. Thanks. Bye!"

Now I don't know what to say. It's like that awkward moment on a first date when you pull up to your favorite restaurant only to find that it's closed for the evening due to a power outage, and your fly is undone. "Thanks power outage," you would most likely say. "Thanks a lot."

I often wonder if this blog would make a good book someday... like a beginner's guide to starting your own art-house cinema (unabridged). Thankfully, it's posts like these that keep me head out of the clouds and my grammar sounding like that of a pirate. In parting, I'd like to leave you with a haiku that I'm going to make up as I type.

meandering post
about art-house cinema
ends with a haiku

No, that was too literal. Let me try again.

damn huge popcorn bags
tempting all with its hugeness
Nicole lifts her hand

Feel free to leave your comments, if any, in the form of a haiku.
author: Dan

comments.author: sara
comments.body:
where is the butter
too many choices await
red sea, cushy seats

comments.author: Gern C. Branston
comments.body: All I need to know is: Will you be offering Jujyfruits?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
jujy fruits are good
pulling the fillings off teeth
offer them we must

comments.author: Brandon Smith
comments.body:
lab work is boring
chemical engineering
while still in high school

see, smart folks like you.
(usually haiku in threes
this one is filler)

dont care about name
i'd visit you anyway
sure most feel the same

comments.author: WhimsyChick aka Isuckathaiku
comments.body:
I suck at haiku
but Dan makes me laugh a lot
so I will attempt

laugh at "take a look"
laughing still at this whole post
still suck at haiku

my attempt was made
you always have my support
comment makes no sense.

comments.author: elspeth
comments.body:
Bright groovy neon
Beacon in the urban night
Moxie, Moxie, Mox...

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
great comments thus far
just got back from birthday lunch
stomach is bloated

comments.author: coco
comments.body:
I can reed and right
pay bills with my master card
and sing the blues too

comments.author: J.W.Y. Latt
comments.body:
My fly is always
down; the restaurant is closed
for good. Think I'll score?

comments.author: anonymous
comments.body:
the mox (or crit) makes
naught as long as it is dark
to fool around, yes?

fire-bright marquee flash,
cool cavern art-show motion,
applause, drinks, and talk.

success, respect, funds,
and something that instills pride.
it's not in the name.

comments.author: Oz
comments.body:
Art house theater
What oh what will your name be?
Confusion settles

comments.author: Mr.T the Messiah
comments.body:
A good haiku must have a reference to nature, see if you can spot it:

Multiplex popcorn
Makes breath and farts smell bad
and leaves crumbs in groin

Geddit? Leaves, anyone? Anyone?

comments.author: mumzii
comments.body:
freedom to create
take the world by happy storm
warm, giggling raindrops
